Posted By: Hibron (4/23/2010 7:53:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is so ridiculously good, enchants are finally decent for the first time in a long time. Primarily because day of judgement is no longer a major threat for creature decks, and because its a 1 mana enchantment that saves your creature, makes it bigger, and smacks first strike on top of that. There are very few times that doing all that for only one mana is ever going to be a bad thing (in the sense that it doesn't save cards from exiling).
  
   
Play with emerge unscathed and vines of vastwood for seriously hard to remove creatures. You can also use aura finesse to swap the auras around, or eel umbra.
posts.html:
This card is so ridiculously good, enchants are finally decent for the first time in a long time. Primarily because day of judgement is no longer a major threat for creature decks, and because its a 1 mana enchantment that saves your creature, makes it bigger, and smacks first strike on top of that. There are very few times that doing all that for only one mana is ever going to be a bad thing (in the sense that it doesn't save cards from exiling).

Play with emerge unscathed and vines of vastwood for seriously hard to remove creatures. You can also use aura finesse to swap the auras around, or eel umbra.

posts.post_content:
Forget about [Lance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lance), here comes the playable version you've been waiting for!  
  
These one-drop totem armors are simply awesome!  
Besides [Crab Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crab Umbra) and [Spider Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spider Umbra), this appears to be the most amazing one by itself.  
  
[Tallowisp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tallowisp) just found a new best friend...or aura.

Posted By: Mode (4/20/2010 3:12:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's not quite as good as [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) in terms of playable auras, but this is still good, and will see play. It prevents 2 for 1's in a lot of situations, but they will still happen fairly often because so much of the removal in Standard is exiling. It's arguable as to which boost is better, +1/+1 and first strike or +2/+0 and trample, would depend on the type of deck you are using if anything; the thing that makes Rancor better is that it is basically impossible to 2 for 1 Rancor, where as it is very easy to do it if you run white against Hyena Umbra.
posts.html:
It's not quite as good as Rancor in terms of playable auras, but this is still good, and will see play. It prevents 2 for 1's in a lot of situations, but they will still happen fairly often because so much of the removal in Standard is exiling. It's arguable as to which boost is better, +1/+1 and first strike or +2/+0 and trample, would depend on the type of deck you are using if anything; the thing that makes Rancor better is that it is basically impossible to 2 for 1 Rancor, where as it is very easy to do it if you run white against Hyena Umbra.
